segment.source: How to Publish a Virtual Application on the Client
segment.target: How to Publish a Virtual Application on the Client

segment.source: How to Publish a Virtual Application on the Client
segment.target: How to Publish a Virtual Application on the Client

segment.source: How to Publish a Virtual Application on the Client
segment.target: How to Publish a Virtual Application on the Client

segment.source: When you deploy Application Virtualization by using an electronic software distribution system, you can use one of the following procedures to publish an application package to your users.
segment.target: When you deploy Application Virtualization by using an electronic software distribution system, you can use one of the following procedures to publish an application package to your users.

segment.source: To publish a package using a stand-alone Windows Installer file
segment.target: To publish a package using a stand-alone Windows Installer file

segment.source: The client should be installed with the REQUIREAUTHORIZATIONIFCACHED parameter set to 0 (zero).
segment.target: The client should be installed with the REQUIREAUTHORIZATIONIFCACHED parameter set to 0 (zero).

segment.source: For more information about setting this parameter, see Application Virtualization Client Installer Command-Line Parameters
segment.target: For more information about setting this parameter, see Application Virtualization Client Installer Command-Line Parameters

segment.source: Copy the Windows Installer file and the SFT file to same folder on the target computer.
segment.target: Copy the Windows Installer file and the SFT file to same folder on the target computer.

segment.source: Run the following command on the computer:
segment.target: Run the following command on the computer:

segment.source: To publish a package using Windows Installer and the package manifest
segment.target: To publish a package using Windows Installer and the package manifest

segment.source: Copy the Windows Installer file to the target computer and the SFT file to the CONTENT share on the streaming server.
segment.target: Copy the Windows Installer file to the target computer and the SFT file to the CONTENT share on the streaming server.

segment.source: Run the following command on each user’s computer:
segment.target: Run the following command on each user’s computer:

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: For OVERRIDEURL all backslash characters must be escaped using a preceding backslash, or the OVERRIDEURL path will not be parsed correctly.
segment.target: For OVERRIDEURL all backslash characters must be escaped using a preceding backslash, or the OVERRIDEURL path will not be parsed correctly.

segment.source: Also, properties and values must be entered as uppercase except where the value is a path to a file.
segment.target: Also, properties and values must be entered as uppercase except where the value is a path to a file.

segment.source: To publish a package using SFTMIME
segment.target: To publish a package using SFTMIME

segment.source: For an example of how to publish an application for all users on a computer, run the following command on the user’s computer:
segment.target: For an example of how to publish an application for all users on a computer, run the following command on the user’s computer:

segment.source: For additional details about these and other SFTMIME commands, see SFTMIME Command Reference.
segment.target: For additional details about these and other SFTMIME commands, see SFTMIME Command Reference.
